conclusion: Block A is on a horizontal ground, block B is pushed horizontally, both blocks are in contact, and friction coefficients are given.
The image shows blocks A and B on a horizontal surface with block B being pushed towards block A.
Identify the force of kinetic friction on block A as \(\mu_2 mg\).
Identify the force of kinetic friction on block B as \(\mu_1 N\).
Use the condition that maximum static friction equals sliding friction: \(\mu_1 N = \mu_2 m g\).
The normal force \(N\) is equal to the weight of block B, so \(N = mg_B\).
Substitute \(N = mg_B\) into the equation: \(\mu_1 m g_B = \mu_2 m g\).
Simplify to find the mass ratio: \(\frac{m_A}{m_B} = \frac{\mu_1}{\mu_2}\).
